content.description: Start in the monopocket at the front of the boulder. Use the jug to the right of the crack of the roof, then traverse left along the edge of the roof to a sidepull pinch. Get this with your left hand, get your feet up, then bump up to a top sloper with your left hand. From here, you have to shimmy along the two slopers at the top. Get as far up with your left hand as you can until the sloper becomes a jug. Get your feet up, put your right foot on that jug in the crack, then send it!
content.location: It is in front of the Nauset Middle School Boulder.

content.description: Skip the undercling and get a sidepull! Someone want to get rid of the poison ivy near the boulder?
content.protection: Bouldering pad, you can get away without one.
content.location: It is located in the woods behind Nauset middle school in Orleans, near the tennis courts.

climbs.name: The Kids Don't Stand a Chance

content.description: Start with a left hand crimp and a right hand up on a hold, doing static start. Do your best to top out!
content.location: It's on the back arête of the Boulder.

content.description: Start at the monopocket in front of the boulder, and work your way straight up the boulder.
content.location: It is on the front of the boulder to right of Unbelievers.

content.description: Follow the finger crack, and top out.
content.protection: A pad, you can get away without one.
content.location: This is the route to the right of the The Kids Don't Stand a Chance on the arête of the back of the boulder.

content.description: Start down low, and work your way up a finger crack.
content.protection: A pad, you can get away without one.
content.location: This is the route left of the back arête of the boulder.

content.description: Traverse the crack over until you get to a pocket crimp, mash on this hold, find the perfect, small foot slot, and pop up high to the jug! Super fun route!
content.protection: A pad, you can get away without one.
content.location: When coming from the lot, it's on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Start with your right hand high on a crimp with your left foot on a micro flake, then make a powerful move up to a left hand gaston. Do a big move with your left hand up to a large, slopey jug.
content.location: It is on the face of the boulder to the left of the Finger Back and right of Everlasting Arms - right up the face where the paint is.
